main event: A civilian reported that 'flying saucers' were being manufactured in Madagascar, accompanied by three sketches of saucers, but the case was evaluated as a hoax with no manufacturing sight found.
interesting points: The report claimed that 'flying saucers' were being manufactured in Madagascar, which sparked the investigation.
The sketches of the saucers showed configurations that could possibly fly, adding complexity to the investigation.
Despite the claim, no manufacturing site was found in Madagascar, leading to the evaluation of the case as a hoax.
A detailed UFO sighting report from Tarrytown, N.Y. on July 16, 1951, described a large silvery object with blue-green coloring, moving at high speed and displaying irregular motion.
The evaluation of the Madagascar possibility discussed the increase in imports not reflected in exports, improvements in communication facilities, and political revisions in the region.
